website_summaries.verdict: Similar to the Ove Glove but with a higher heat tolerance. Comes in 3 colors.
pros: Can be thrown into the wash and are very comfortable to wear thanks to a super flexible design
They have rubber grips for safe handling
Provides heat protection up to 900º F. Quality construction ensures you'll be using these for a long time
cons: Won't protect you from hot water or steam

website_summaries.verdict: Give the protection of traditional mitts without the awkward, crab-like design.
pros: Insulated by M-aramid and P-aramid fabrics (like Nomex and Kevlar)
Choice of women's size, standard size, extra-long cuff, and steam resistant
Comes in red, black, gray, multi, blue, and gray
cons: Gloves don't protect well when wet
Some start feeling heat after 400°F, even when dry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect when used as intended
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do exactly what they are supposed to do. They insulate perfectly when handling hot pots or pans from the oven. Even touching an oven rack directly to change heights is not a problem for these gloves. Just be aware these are not intended for prolonged contact although I have been able to easily hold hot pans for over a minute without feeling uncomfortable heat. One more word of caution - these are not intended, and will not protect against wet heat - hot water, oil, or grease. When used as intended these are perfect and very durable. The only downside is that they are difficult to clean if they get dirty with oil or greasy food.
customer_reviews.author: syeb

customer_reviews.title: Lets a lot of heat through
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if we got a defective pair or what but I got this for my husband and the first time he used it he said he could feel the heat coming through from the pan straight to his fingers. He almost dropped the pan in surprise because it was almost hot enough to burn him. We've both tried it a few times since then and every time it gets too hot almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A huge improvement over potholders
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with these oven mitts. They are much better for moving heavy or large items in and out of a hot oven (like the Dutch oven I was trying to maneuver recently, burning myself in the process, which made me spring for these things). I'd recommend these to anyone who bakes or broils. One note: Though I don't consider my hands to be particularly large, the mitts fit pretty snugly. That's fine for me, since too big and loose could cause problems, but for anyone who buys extra large gloves, there could be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: dtobisk

customer_reviews.title: Hot.  Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: They get hot! And after only a few use they are tearing up in between fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Fung, MD

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I use these to grab food off the smoker. They've always worked great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sims

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for home kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to use than those silicone or fabric hot pads. Have small hands so they are super easy to put on and take off. LOVE that they are able to be used on either hand - will make them last longer. Thanks for the info on how to care for them and how to put on take off. This manufacturer pays attention and stands behind this product.
customer_reviews.author: instant grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, albeit a bit costly
customer_reviews.text: These are great for all aspects of cooking and grilling. I never have to worry about burning my hands accidentally or wondering if something is too hot for my (now retired) old gloves, The way the pattern is on the gloves makes them quite difficult to clean if you get food on them and I feel like they should be at or below $20. Other than that, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of BBQ Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the BBQ grill scene, so I thought I could get away with oven mitts. Those didn't quite do the trick, plus i found myself burning my fingers at inopportune times. found these online from Amazon. They're great. They're pretty durable and very heat resistant. It can be a bit problematic having to use my fingers for very delicate and small movements, but better than getting burned. I sometimes just use them as impromptu oven mitts when I need to do quick work. Great pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean Guy

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip on hot stuff!
customer_reviews.text: We used these gloves at a church dinner for several hundred people. Husband was in charge of bringing trays of food, hot from the oven, to the chafing dishes on the buffet table. These gloves made it easy work! He had a better grip on the hot pans because the gloves gave him dexterity. Oven mitts don't provide the same grip, and simply aren't as good at deflecting heat. After the dinner was over, he could handle the sterno containers to extinguish them with ease. We ordered a pair as soon as we got home from the dinner. They are THAT good.
customer_reviews.author: Demosthenes

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck Getting this Liner Back In
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have a liner that comes out when you pull your hand from the gloves. Once out, it is next to impossible to put the liner back into the finger holds. People are saying these gloves don't have a liner, but the gloves I bought do. Don't buy these unless you have an extra 10 minutes every time to put the gloves back together. Fun as untangling fishing line.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Does what it advertises - Used to handle firewood in blazing camp fire...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping to protect my hands while handling burning wood for the camp fire or moving the grate. Worked well.. didn't get burned and didn't feel much heat. It's pretty amazing. The only thing to note is that it does get dirty. I thought ahead about this and bought the grey version but it's still dirty looking. Oh well, it's still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kendoso

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gloves...no more burns!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are magnificent. They grip anything and everything, and hold up well when dealing with high temps from the oven. The only thing I might change is the size. I have small hands, and these are very large. I still love them, though!! They're fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: McDanTam

customer_reviews.title: My pizza gloves, works well when I take out ...
customer_reviews.text: My pizza gloves, works well when I take out my hot cast iron pan at 550f degrees, not as noticeable heat, compared to cheap gloves in which you can feel through. Would buy again for my pizza making, about the only thing I use them for and cheap food I make in the toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: kaori

customer_reviews.title: Nice grill gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure, but you may be able to pick up handfuls of lava with these things. These are not only great on the grill but also just as general oven mitts as well. The silicone stripes are nicely tacky and help avoid drops from slippage. My hands run medium-large and these fit nicely. If you have really large hands, they may be a bit of a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: No burn, no slip
customer_reviews.text: Love these, love them... great product. For oven use or handling hot stuff over 700 degree Big Green Egg coals.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and perfect for any kitchen
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work even under super hot temperatures. They are flexible, so you can pick things up without feeling like you can't move your fingers. They have a little hook on the inside so you can hang them. They are quite large. My hands are a little larger than normal women's hands, but it isn't a problem at all. They should work men as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Puryear

customer_reviews.title: Works well for BBQ and Suppressors (Silencers/ Can)
customer_reviews.text: Works well for BBQ and silencers. Just not for extended periods... Gab and handle item for a few seconds and you won't get burn or feel the heat too bad on your BBQ items... As for the silencer, it will allow you to get a grip on the can, just don't grab too tightly. Release your grip in intervals while turning it loose, until you can handle it briefly on your cover palm.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: A must for every grill and BBQ Update: They haven’t let me down and are great heat resistance to some very hot areas around the BBQ grill. Made extremely well. A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RAI-DURS

customer_reviews.title: A fine product! I have some cooking gloves that have ...
customer_reviews.text: A fine product! I have some cooking gloves that have worn out and can give one an uncomfortable burn. These gloves are really terrific. I can use them on hot pots and not feel any discomfort. Will this last? That is the next question to be tested! It is a test that I welcome. . . .
customer_reviews.author: Steven PetersonTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: these gloves are a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: these gloves are a bit bulky and the inside finger holes are a bit small for my husband who has large fingers and hand. they work good for the pan handle that always seems to be very hot, works great for the hot burger flipper on the grill, no more burned fingers
customer_reviews.author: martha chizek

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Gloves were a gift for the family griller. He used them immediately on the kitchen Wolf range. Gave him the recipe book and he was really pleased; salmon has been a challenge. And the grill cleaning instructions will be very useful. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lois M Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection!

One thing to be aware of is, if you have thick fingers, these gloves may be too tight for your fingers. I'm not sure why they were made so narrow, and hopefully the mfg will make adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Olson

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: I got these when my boyfriend and I moved in together to replace the hideous orange rubber ones he used for everything. These are so easy to clean and protect our hands perfectly, and now the orange ones are lying forgotten in the drawer (until I sneakily throw them out during his next business trip). Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Wright

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: I bake with cast iron dutch ovens and I can lift them out of a 250C oven with no trouble. It's great using gloves as opposed to a cloth or mitt as you seem to have much better control. I love these and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: LWills

customer_reviews.title: A Safe Glove
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea to have a glove fit your hand so that hot items can be removed from the oven safely. We threw out another pair of mitts with the silicone coating thinking this would be ideal. We both got burned twice and almost dropped an entire casserole dish. But with Grill Gloves we now feel confident when removing items from the oven or BBQ.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Recommend these glove! can with stand my 450 F degree iron skillets no problem
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have been using them now for baking for 5 months. I use those old school iron skillets to make pizza and bread. I sometimes bring the tempature of the oven to 450 F degrees. Regular cotton oven mitts would start to burn right away since the iron retains the heat really well, so I decided I needed something more heavy duty. These glove are great. I can hold the iron skillet for about 5 secs until I start to feel the heat which is more then enough time to transfer back and forth for oven. I have about medium size hands and they still fit pretty well. If you have really small hands might not fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how great these are...waited to review til I'd given them a good test, and they've proven themselves over and over. I use as my oven mitts (replacing a not-inexpensive pair of silicone gloves which did work, but had NO dexterity and wouldn't fit up over my wrists, too narrow - rendering them rather useless for gripping items to remove from the oven). Bought two pairs to also use with our woodstoves and wood cookstove, confident that they will serve us well for years to come. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Shepherdess

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are ambidextrous and fit either hand. They are thick, but stretchy and will fit a hand, medium to extra large. They are not waterproof, but are washable and can withstand extremely high heat.
customer_reviews.author: Biker wife

customer_reviews.title: Not So High Temp
customer_reviews.text: They're okay but my husband could feel the heat through the glove very easily when pulling a casarole out of the oven from 375F so I highly doubt they will do any good at 932F. I had bought these for when he makes dishes on in the dutch oven with hot coals and there is no way I would recommend that at this point. He will continue to use welding gloves for that. These are okay for the house and look a lot better than the nasty old Ov Glove he's been using for several years now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to high heat!

Considered getting the ladies small, but not sure it's worth it. I'm guessing that they'll be maybe too tight. Going to keep these because my daughter may be able to use them.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Protection

customer_reviews.author: Wayne N.

And you get two gloves for the same price as one ove glove. They work, I will say, you cannot just hold onto a blazing hot pan etc for ever you can feel it warm up after holding it for a while. But that is fine, they still work awesome. Have not tried with grilling yet.
customer_reviews.author: KB DJ

customer_reviews.title: Better fit and better grip than my ove glove
customer_reviews.text: These fit better and are made to fit either hand unlike my old ove glove that was made to fit only the right hand. I like these gloves much better than the ove glove.
customer_reviews.author: Scotie

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Before this I had the ove glove it couldn't take Heat this takes high heat without any problem at all washes beautifully and I hang it on the side of the refrigerator I've no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Astrid Richey

customer_reviews.title: Best gift my mother-in-law ever got me.
customer_reviews.text: Best addition to my grilling and smoking equipment. My hands do not feel the heat while cleaning hot grates and I don't fumble my whole chickens when reaching in the smoker. They are easy to clean but make sure to follow the directions. I threw mine in the washer and let them air dry afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: bsrstone

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought myself a pair.
customer_reviews.text: Got some for my dad for Father’s Day. Liked them so much I had to get a pair of my own. I use mine to flip griddles on top of my grill. Holds up to a lot of direct heat.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for hubby!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband for Christmas, and he really likes them. He calls himself the Grill Master, so now he feels even more powerful because he can pick up flaming hot stuff with his hands without burning himself 😂
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves that provide needed protection from high temperature tasks. Seem a bit bulky but most likely the reason they are so effective. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MovieFan

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the BBQ
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit well and are excellent around the BBQ and Komado. Be careful when you wash to not include delicates with them at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Beyea

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase this year!
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!! these are amazing. able to grab 450degree cast iron pan from oven with NO discernible heat tranfer AT ALL. These may be my best purchase all year. :)
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. Mainly cause of the fingers. Aftter using the mitt style for years, switching to this is a revelation. You just have so much more control. I have yet to wash these but I imagine it would be pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I use these Grill Armor oven gloves when cooking on my new kamado grill. They are far superior to the big leather gloves, easier to grab utensils and grill grates, more heat resistant, and easier to clean when they get greasy. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible kitchen staple
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. After messing around with oven mitts for my entire life I finally picked up a pair of these because of a YouTuber who recommended them. They are phenomenal. After holding a burning hot cast iron pan for 5 straight minutes butter basting a steak I finally noticed my hand getting a bit warm. Quickly switch hands and was able to finish no problem. These keep the heat off!

customer_reviews.title: Heat makes it through

This may also be creating the expanded gaps letting in more heat. Right sized gloves maybe better than one size expanding ones for this use.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltar

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for cast iron cooking. I have not washed them yet. They have been great for taking out hot pans that were in an oven at 500*

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: These heat resistant gloves work great! You cannot hold very hot things for too long but you don't need to in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: They Work
customer_reviews.text: Not even the slightest sign off heat comes thru when grabbing the broiler out of the oven, they work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: C-Dog

customer_reviews.title: Small but Effective
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves to handle hot machine gun barrels and suppressors which easily exceed 600°F. These work good because of the grippy texture which helps get leverage on carbon seized silencers and protect against the heat long enough to remove them from one host and attach them to another. I would've given them 5 stars if they were bigger-- they're really tight on me, almost too small to fit. They do stretch out a little bit but not nearly enough. They work better for my purposes than a welding glove over tactical gloves, like I said I only wish they were bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sell

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the negative reviews, they’re great... if
customer_reviews.text: you use them as intended. You can take your hand and hold it face down on a 500+ degree grill for a decent amount of time and feel nothing, but no, you can’t pick up a red hot and heavy as hell cast iron skillet and walk inside with it. Nothing replaces potholders, but these are for working on the grill only, and they are great at that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for certain tasks.
customer_reviews.text: They do work. They are not magic. Your hand will still get hot after a short period. They will not replace a good oven mitt, but for tasks where you need extra control, they are indispensable. They work very well for handling hot cast iron pans, such as baking bread in a cast iron combo set Tartine style. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Bill Higgans

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We had a cheaper glove that worked okay. If you held something hot just a little too long the heat would start come through. These new gloves are a lot thicker and have not let any heat through at all. Well worth the higher price. Only complaint, they are a little snug. I imagine they will stretch just a tad which will make them fit just right so am not giving a less than 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C. Pursel

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: Above 400 degrees you start to really feel the heat. Be careful over 425 degrees. At 450 degrees you have only 2-3 seconds to avoid getting burned. I use my oven a lot so I know what I'm talking about. They do fit tight like others said.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good for coffee roasting!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for about 5 months now for coffee roasting. I am able to hold a 600 degree metal drum for a minute or so. The gloves do wear down after a lot of use and heat starts to hit quicker. But low heats of 300 or 200 take many minutes to even start to feel anything!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Impressed

customer_reviews.title: They do what I expected

customer_reviews.title: Don't let them get wet

customer_reviews.title: A little more difficult to use if you have smaller hands
